title: No Seriously Tryndamere Ultimate is Unfair
body:
Match: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1855599190/48728987?tab=stats

Now before you bite my head off please allow me to start off by saying I am not writing this in quick response after a terrible loss to a {{champion:23}}  in lane or during any stage of the game. In this game I actually won and the {{champion:23}}  did pretty horrible but thats the problem, he did horrible and yet he still had as much pressure on the map as one of the strongest threats on the enemy team.  Yea you look at the match history and we are down as much as 4.6k gold @ 31 minutes, but thats not off kills, thats off relentless split push and at one point one of our members afked for around 15 minutes+ ({{champion:33}} ).  Nonetheless the other members were able to cause chaos and set an environment where this guy was able to get to towers semi-unattended, and without much of  our CC there in {{champion:33}}, dealing with him and preventing a Kamikaze to a turret is near impossible due to his ultimate. We were down a man and needed answers to stop the bleeding, that answer came when {{champion:33}}  reconnected, but even after {{champion:23}}  still crashed into tower after tower then inhib after inhib.

The problem is that unlike any other split push type champion ({{champion:77}} , {{champion:238}}  , {{champion:157}} {{champion:114}} ,{{champion:24}}  etc.) ; this champ for solely no other reason than his absurd ultimate is allowed to be a relentless threat throughout the entire game. All of these other splitpush champs can be monsters late game, are insane duelists and have very potent ultimate's. But what makes {{champion:23}}  an outlier is that his ultimate allows him to cheat death while being able deal absurd amounts of damage. The result is the demise of a very low enemy team, due to {{champion:23}}  being able to clean up really easy without the presence of abundant and dedicated hard CC; or in this case as it's relevant to this post and this game, being able to take towers regardless of his score because he can just build full damage due to his absurd ultimate.

Seriously think about it logically, you encounter a {{champion:114}}  who is [0/7/1] 20 minutes into the game with only 100 cs. Do you think it possible and fair for her to just be able to take two top towers? Of course if objectives are left unattended  or no moves on the map continue for long enough such champs can ramp up and run rampant. However would it still be fair for said champ to have an ultimate that can just ignore your attempts at stopping them (literately just dying to take the tower at that point), with no defensive items and only an ultimate to keep them alive long enough to be a martyr for an objective? Would it be fair for said champ to end the game [0/23/4] and in the course of that time take 3 separate inhibitors twice each using the same method?

Sure some better champ picks and perhaps more concentrated grouping may have alleviated the issue but a {{champion:77}}  was on that team as well and we all know what that champ loves to do all day. You guess it, split push. At a certain point you cant just ignore them, especially if your push just isnt as strong even as 5 much less 4 for a fair part of the game (which is absurd considering the score of the Trynd). The only reason we won this game was because we could group even as 3 or 4 and win against them in their unit of 3 or 4. But with two champs hell bent on split pushing, even baron and 5th drag were hard to utilize due to the fact {{champion:23}}  could just kamikaze any inhib tower at any time. Yes I stayed at base duty, to try and mitigate this but look how long the game took to close out. The point is a champs mechanics shouldn't be so potent that it allows players to forcibly take very important objectives at will, with no skill but mere force of will.

I seriously feel like no matter what you do, or how behind this champ is  you're not allowed to leave this champ in a lane on his own, only due to his ultimate and usual build path. That players who play this champ are allowed and know they can abuse the nature of this champ and force constant pressure no matter how they play individually. Thats ridiculous I know there are fans and even mains of this champ/play style. Not everyone will agree I may be even horribly downvoted  with my Elo somehow coming into question. None of that really matters though because of all champs that currently exist in this game, this champs uncanny ability to do what he does is unrivaled. It's a broken mechanic and it's tiresome it's overlooked. This isn't a tank we're talking about ({{champion:12}} )  this is a full on bruiser that can delete squishies and melt tanks, why does he even need this ultimate? He has a gap closer that can jump through terrain, a slow and a self heal along with a passive that makes his crits so dangerous. He's already loaded for splitpush and is probably the best at it, even for escaping. Why should he be allowed to effectively Zhonyas while moving and do tons of damage? It's Scion passive on crack and its needs to be changed.

I know absolute balance cannot be truly attained in the game, however I do feel that the game should try it's best to be balanced. When I say balance please do realize I mean not just how powerful champs are but the risks/rewards and player performance and how that has an impact overall.  Anything can change a game, throws happen, but this shouldnt be allowed to happen, it's honestly an outlier with a direct cause. A single ability should not grant a player pseudo-immunity once they hit 6 to take any objective they please. Thank you for reading if you did read this far.

TL: DR- Trynd has a really unfair Ultimate that allows him to do whatever he pleases in many situations, even if he is doing abysmal. It should be changed so that it doesnt allow players to just press R and feel free to take anything they want despite their performance, whether that be a single players life or an objective.

You're not getting a lot of support, but I can actually attest to this. Whether Tryndamere is ahead or not, he's going to splitpush until he gets to your base. A {{champion:11}} or {{champion:114}}  you can sneak up on and kill with planning. A {{champion:75}}, {{champion:24}}, or {{champion:98}} you can beat early so they have no relevance. A {{champion:27}}  you can even ignore, it takes him forever to take objectives. A {{champion:23}} has enough strength in his kit to make his split pushing matter, no matter how many items he has. If you collapse on him he'll spin away. If he's low he'll ult, and if he has a good understanding of the game he'll juke you out. This gives one of two options, either gather your team and be hellbent on pushing harder than him, or have someone baby him the entire time, both of which will fail eventually as he gets stronger. 
Just the very fact he's in the game limits your options to win, severely. This doesn't mean it works every time, he still depends on his team to make the right decisions, which if they don't then his pushing will fail before he takes too much. But the point OP is making is that no champion should limit you as hard as he does, its broken in and of itself.

As an Ex-Tryn main I can tell you with certainty that most of what you're saying is unfair are things that are easily mitigated by following the fundementals.
For example, stuff like proper team comp (Having Hard CC and lockdown, disengage, etc), knowing how to poke or force ultimates, etc.

After I hit lv 30 and got out of bronze, I've seen tryndamere's viability go down significantly outside of a pub-stomping bruiser, simply because his ult makes him unkillable for 4 seconds. Seriously, that's really the only thing he's got going for him that NO ONE else does. He has subpar bruiser DPS (even with the best runes and items for it), no hard CC, ONE gapcloser/terrain cross, and a small AD steroid and non-chunk situational heal.

Playing as tryndamere made it fairly easy for me to see the drawbacks to his kit and playstyle and it's counterplay options, and you also seem to be forgetting they've nerfed his ultimate AND his splitpushing power since his release, and that the "small" meta changes during S4 and S5 away from bruiser/assassins towards mobile DPS and tanks has only made it harder for him.

The majority of tryndameres I see today are only a real team threat against bad comps, people who can't counter-itemize (AKA Armor), and people who let MULTIPLE lanes get pushed up. Every other tryn ever normally goes into a teamfight and has to pop ult during a dive to enable his team to toe with the enemy, then dies. There are multiple champs out there that does everything tryn does (and used to do) better, and have more going for them. 

Okay, long rant done. The short one is this:
Do you have any Idea what a slippery slope you're on? You don't like Tryn's ult. I get it. But if Riot listens to you and changes one champion's defining ability, what's there to stop them from redoing {{champion:53}}'s Rocket Grab, or {{champion:30}}'s  Requiem, or {{champion:96}}'s Icanthian Surprise based on someone not liking it? 
When Riot makes a champion, they're designed around a theme, and the abilities in that champion's kit reflect that theme. That theme does not get changed without a very, Very, VERRRRYY good reason, and unless the whole playerbase, the koreans, the pros, and Chuck Norris agrees on that reason, it likely won't get changed.

Hell, {{champion:69}} , {{champion:16}} , and even {{champion:45}} 's ults didn't get changed even when their kits got MAJOR overhauls. Think about it.

Tryndamere as a _champion_ is unfair. Not just his ultimate. And he violates so many of Riot's balance philosophies that it's not even funny. Champions have been ruined or completely stripped of their identity for far less.

Where do we even begin?

**Passive.** Oh god, the passive. With how much Riot hates RNG it's a wonder how the hell is this still here. It's not fun in any situation. Early on, Tryndamere spins into your face, and from there you have 2 scenarios: 
1.) He crits you 2 times. He just won his lane as you recalling because next time he will kill you - if you're not already dead.
2.) RNGesus does not look upon him and you will probably win the trade... unless he maxed W, but more on that later.
**Both of these scenarios are 100% reliant on RNG, and 0% on skill. There is no satisfaction for the losing side, no feeling that you got rightfully outplayed. No - either you got lucky or he got lucky.**

**Q** Gives him AD based on missing HP. Not a big deal, you might say - **but Karma got her entire kit, character and personality scrapped, with her passive being called out as one of big reasons.** To quote Riot's opinion on that "Old Karma's passive felt extremely frustrating to play against - since she got stronger with low HP, you felt punished for playing well against her".
And Tryndamere not only gets the same sort of invisible power, **but also gets a 5 second window at 1 HP where he can abuse it at its strongest.** Consistency is strong here.

**W** This ability is the definition of low counterplay, invisible power and many buzzwords Riot keeps throwing around. Slow is fine, but for the love of God, _why the hell does it remove 80 AD in an AoE?_
Now, let's calculate that in gold value: 1 point of AD costs 36 gold. With a simple, unavoidable click of a button, Tryndamere removes 80x36 = **2880 GOLD VALUE IN AD from his target** In team fights, it amounts to 14400 gold in lost stats. Lost to an unavoidable, instant AoE.
Still not enough for you? Say Tryndamere maxes W first. Aatrox, for instance, has 82 base AD at level 9. After Trynd uses his W, he's left at, what? 2 base AD? **That's more than 95% reduction.** Ok, say he completed his damage item - BotrK. He now has AD of 27, not counting %HP effect. Mind you, Urgot's 15% reduction is considered extremely toxic by Riot.

This ability, by default, causes Trynd to effortlessly win against any AD-based champion. And here we come to another of Riot's favourite buzzwords - **false choices.** You know you can't fight him because he'll cut most of your AD, but you also can't run since he'll slow you and chase you down with his RNG-reseting gap closer.

**E** This ability is not bad by itself - but put RNGesus in the equation, and oh boy. He might jump on you, eat you alive with crits and  immediately jump out... or jump in and remain stuck. 100% luck, 0% skill.

**R** Funny thing. This is actually the most balanced part of Tryndamere's kit. He can use it to fight or escape, rarely both and can be countered with a DoT. Frustrating, yes - but not as much as the rest.

**TL;DR** Tryndamere is a toxic mess of a champion that can't be salvaged by less than a full-on rework.
